<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 7"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Crown of Insight](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1289)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Tattoo" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=262" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 38</row>

**Price** 360 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** tattoo

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

A series of evenly spaced, unblinking tattooed eyes line your skin. When you enter an area that contains creatures within 60 feet that are unnoticed to you, the GM rolls a [secret](/Traits.aspx?ID=142) Perception check for you against the creatures' [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) DCs. On a success, the creature becomes [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39) by you, rather than [unnoticed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=41), and on a critical success, the creature becomes [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22) to you. All creatures in the area are then temporarily immune to your _crown of insight_ for 24 hours. The _crown of insight_ doesn't help you find hidden items or traps, nor can it help you discern a creature hiding in plain sight, such as a [gargoyle](/Monsters.aspx?ID=210) pretending to be an inanimate statue. Additionally, since the effect occurs when you move to enter an area that contains creatures, it doesn't detect an unnoticed creature [Sneaking](/Actions.aspx?ID=63) up on you.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
